name: T'Ang
description: Lavender Pink. Large, semidouble with irregular, upright, wavy petals. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha' seedling). (U.S. 1966 - E. Rideout, Laguna Hills, CA).

name: T's Rose
description: Dark Velvet Red with Yellow anthers and Red filaments. Small, formal double to rose form double with fully imbricated mid-season to late blooms; late season blooms are rose form double. Slow, bushy, medium density growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Royal Velvet'). (U.S. 2022 - John Davy, Pace, FL).

name: T. C. Patin
description: Light Red. Very large, full semidouble with irregular, large petals and spray of large stamens. Vigorous, bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1974 - T. C. Patin, Hammond, LA).

name: T. C. Patin Variegated
description: Light Red blotched and marked White variation of 'T C Patin'. (U.S. 1974 - T. C. Patin, Hammond, LA).

name: T. Morris
description: Medium Pink with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Large, semidouble to rose form double. Vigorous, upright, medium density growth. M. (Seedling of Reticulata hybrid 'Nuccio's Ruby). (U.S. 2023 - Jim Smelley, Moss Point, MS).

name: T. P. Bowen
description: White with Blush Pink iridescent undertone. Miniature, formal double. Bushy growth. M. (U.S. 1977 - Haynie).

name: T. S. Clower, Jr.
description: White with narrow Pink stripe. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, slender, open growth. M. (U.S. 1950 - Clower).

name: Tabbs
description: Crimson marbled and blotched White. Medium to large, full peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Helenor'). (Aus. 1856 - Guilfoyle).

name: Tabitha
description: Light Pink flushed Rose; sports White streaked Deep Rose or Red, Fuchsia, and Fuchsia with one White petal. Large, semidouble. Spreading, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1963 - Mrs. K. H. McEachern, Wilmington, NC).

name: Tada Meibi
description: Rose overcast Salmon. Miniature, formal double with incurved center petals. Slow growth. E-M. (U.S. 1986 - Stone).

name: Taffeta Tutu
description: Apricot Pink with Pink petal edges blending to Lemon Yellow at center. Large, semidouble to loose peony form with upright petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. Fragrant. (U.S. 1959 - Dr. L. W. Fawns, Fresno, CA).

name: Tafuku-Benten (Happy Goddess)
description: ('Benten-tsubaki'; 'Otafuku-benten'). Pink blotched and edged White. Medium, single. Vigorous, spreading growth. M. (Japan 1956 - E. Satomi, Tokyo).

name: Tahiti
description: Bright Red. Medium, single with splayed stamens. Vigorous, upright growth. M. Fragrant. (Aus. 1959 - G. Waterhouse).

name: Tai-Tai
description: Pink. Medium to large, formal double. Vigorous, spreading growth. E-M. (U.S. 1966 - J. P. Woo, Fresno, CA).

name: Taihai
description: See 'Osakazuki'.

name: Taiheiraku
description: See 'Daitairin'.

name: Taishuhai
description: White shading to Deep Red on edge. Medium to large, single.

name: Takane-No-Yuki
description: Soft Pink petals, veined Deeper Pink with wide, White center, with Gold anthers and White filaments. Medium, single with crinkled edges. (Japan 1931 - Tôbei Yoshida, Kiso River, Chûbu).

name: Takanini
description: Deep Purplish Red. Small to medium, semidouble, anemone form centered. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (N.Z. 1989 - Haydon).

name: Takara-Awase (Treasure Trove)
description: Pink shaded White and bordered Pink. Unknown size, semidouble.

name: Takueiyeh
description: See 'Large Osmanthus Leaf

name: Tali Queen
description: ('Dali Cha' - Chinese Name). Turkey Red to Deep Pink. Very large, semidouble with irregular petals and with very large, heavily textured outer petals and wavy inner petals interspersed with clusters of stamens. Average, upright growth. M. (Yunnan Reticulata). (China to U.S. 1948 - Descanso and Peer).

name: Tallahassee Girl
description: Blush Pink. Medium, semidouble to peony form. Upright growth. M. (U.S. 1948 - Rosa).

name: Talmont
description: White. Large, formal double. Average, spreading, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1967 - Mrs. W. P. Bevis, Tallahassee, FL).

name: Tam O'Shanter
description: Deep Rose outer petals and dainty Pink center petals. Medium to large, rose form double. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1967 - Haynie).

name: Tama Americana
description: Rose Red with broad White border. Medium, semidouble with occasional petaloids. Average, open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Anemone
description: Rose Red with White border, irregular but usually narrow with Golden anthers and White filaments. medium, anemone form. Average, compact, rounded growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica "Tama-no-ura'). (U.S. 2021 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Tama Bambino
description: Rose Pink bordered White. Miniature to small, peony form with narrow, pointed petals. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Beauty
description: Rose Pink bordered White. Medium to large, loose peony form. Average, dense growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Bell
description: White with Red at base of petals. Miniature to small, bell-shaped single. Vigorous, loose, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Carousel
description: Pink with a White border. Medium, semidouble with center petals that standup and occasional petaloids. Medium, upright, bushy growth. E-M. (Japonica "Tama-no-ura' × Japonica 'Nuccio's Carousel'). (U.S. 2014 - Bradford King, Arcadia, CA).

name: Tama Electra
description: Brilliant Dark Red bordered White. Small to medium, single. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Glitters
description: Red bordered White. Medium to large, semidouble to loose peony form. Average, spreading, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Loch Laurel
description: Red with White border around petals with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, loose peony to semidouble with petals in center of flower are narrow, similar to petaloids. Average, upright growth. M. (Japonica 'Tama Electra' seedling). (U.S. 2016 - Mark Crawford, Valdosta, GA).

name: Tama Peacock
description: Maroonish Red washing to a White border. Small to medium, semidouble form. Upright, pendulous growth. M-L. (U.S. 2000 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Velvet
description: Dark Red with a White border of varying width with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, semidouble. Average, upright, spreading growth. E-M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Tama-no-ura'). (U.S. 2018 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama Vino
description: Wine Red washing to broad White border. Small to medium, semidouble with long, narrow petals. Average, upright growth. E- M. (U.S. 1993 - Nuccio's).

name: Tama-Ikari
description: Light Pink. Medium, single with circular Pale Yellow stamens. See Higo.

name: Tama-No-Ura
description: Red bordered White. Small to medium, single. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Japan 1973 to U.S. 1978 - Nuccio's).

name: Tamagasumi
description: Faint Blush Pink with slender flecks of Red with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, single opening to a spherical/ cupped shape. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Tar'an'). (Japan 1968 - Shun'ichi Sakuragi, Chûbu Area).

name: Tamborine's Jewel
description: Fuchsine Pink. Medium, semidouble; 19-20 petals in 3 tiers. Average, broad, upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 1999 - Kevin J. Coase, Tamborine Mtn., Qld.).

name: Tamie Fraser
description: Pale Pink center shading to Deeper Pink on outer petal edges. Large, anemone form to peony form. Average, dense, upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 1989 - M. Fraser, Nareen, Vic.).

name: Tamlin Fortner
description: Dark Red with Yellow anthers and Red filaments. Large to very large, semidouble. Average, upright, open growth. M-L. (Seedling of Japonica 'Scarlet Glory'). (U.S. 2017 - Pat Johnson, Cairo, (A).

name: Tammia
description: White with Pink center and border. Miniature to small, formal double with incurved geometric petals. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1971 - Tammia).

name: Tammia Blush
description: Blush Pink center with Darker Pink border. (Sport of Japonica 'Tammia'). (U.S. 1977 - Tammia).

name: Tammia Fire Opal
description: White flecked and streaked radiant Scarlet. (Sport of Japonica 'Tammia'). (U.S. 1978 - J L Carvain, Dallas, TX).

name: Tammia Speckled
description: White with sunken center and border, with Red speckles. Miniature to small, formal double with incurved geometric petals. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (Sport of Japonica 'Tammia').

name: Tammy
description: Bright Pink. Large, formal double. Vigorous, upright, dense growth. E-M. (U.S. 2013 - Howell).

name: Tamzin Coull
description: Deep Pink. Large, rose form double. Open, upright growth. M. (N.Z. 1980 - Mrs. B. J. Rayner, Stratford).

name: Tancho
description: White streaked Crimson. Medium, single. See Higo.

name: Tango
description: Black Red Crimson. Large to very large, formal double. Average, dense, spreading, upright growth. E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Carl Tourje' × Reticulata hybrid 'Craig Clark'). (U.S. 1996 - Hall).

name: Tanya
description: Deep Rose Pink. Small, single.

name: Tar Baby
description: Blood Red. Medium, anemone form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1985 - Dr. M. B. Wine, Thomasville, GA).

name: Tarantella
description: Vibrant Red with Bright Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Medium, peony form. Vigorous, upright, average density growth. E-M. [(Sasanqua x Reticulata hybrid 'Gael's Dream') x Japonica 'Takanini']. (New Zealand, 2008 - Neville Hayden, Takanini).

name: Taro-An (Name Given To Japanese Tea House)
description: Soft Pink. Medium, single with large, round petals and heavy stamens of magnolia form. Vigorous growth. E-M. (Japan 1936 - Chugai).

name: Taro-Kaja
description: ('Judith'). Pink. Small, single bell form.

name: Tasasago
description: Pale Pink. Medium, single with flared Pale Yellow stamens. See Higo.

name: Tashiro
description: White. Medium, rose form double.

name: Tata
description: White. Large to very large, semidouble. Vigorous, spreading, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1991 - Nuccio's).

name: Tatters
description: White. Medium, peony form. M. (Saluenensis x Japonica). (Aus. 1962 - Waterhouse).

name: Taylor Maid
description: Bright Pink. Large, anemone form. Average, compact, upright growth. M. (Saluenensis × Japonica). (N.Z. 1984 - J. Taylor, Alton, Taranaki).

name: Taylor's Perfection
description: Light Pink. Large, semidouble with occasional petaloids. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis seedling). (N.Z. 1975 - J. Taylor, Alton).

name: Taylor's Supreme
description: Rose Pink. Large, semidouble with some petaloids. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Saluenensis seedling). (N.Z. 1975 - J. Taylor, Alton).

name: Te Deum
description: ('Dr. Shepherd'; 'Firegold'; 'Morague'; 'Pasha of Persia'; 'Shah of Persia'). Dark Red. Large, semidouble to formal double. Slow, open growth. M-L. (Probably same as cultivar 'Grand Sultan' which would have priority but, as "Te Deum' has been in such common use in the US, we do not believe a change is necessary or warranted). (Europe to U.S. 1890 - Tea Gardens).

name: Tea Garden 45
description: Dark Red. Medium, semidouble of cupped form Vigorous, compact growth. L. (U.S. 1942 - Tea Gardens).

name: Teckla
description: Coral Pink. Medium, semidouble with crepe petals. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1958 - E. L. Stelling, Augusta, GA).

name: Teckla Variegated
description: Deep Pink and White variation of "Teckla'.

name: Ted Craig
description: Red. Very large, semidouble. Average, spreading, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'William Hertrich' × Japonica 'Drama Girl'). (Aus. 1993 - I. Craig, N. Bondi, NSW).

name: Ted Kohl
description: Rose Red. Large, full semidouble. Average, compact growth. (U.S. 1958 - J. W. Bradford, San Diego, CA).

name: Ted Kohl Variegated
description: Rose Red heavily blotched White variation of "Ted Kohl.'.

name: Tedd Gilley
description: Dark Red. Large, loose peony form. Average, spreading, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1973 - Gilley).

name: Teddie Ulmer
description: Deep Red. Medium to large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1972 - Mealing).

name: Teddy, Jr.
description: Fuchsia Pink. Small, semidouble to rose form double with small upright petaloids with lily-like tops. (U.S. 1961 - F. Griffin, Sr., Columbia, SC).

name: Tee Bird
description: Pink with Red stripes and flecks. Small, formal double; the bloom has a large center bud. Average, upright, dense growth. L. (U.S. 2016 - Howell).

name: Teen Age Queen
description: Blush Pink usually with one small Pink tripe. Large, thick semidouble. Compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1969 Shackelford).

name: Teenager
description: Rose Pink. Medium, single.

name: Telstar
description: White, inside Light Pink to Dark Pink with Rose border. Medium, semidouble with crinkled petals.

name: Temple Bowen
description: Deep Red. Large to very large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata/ Non-Reticulata hybrid). (U.S. 1981 - Pursel).

name: Temple Festival
description: Red. Very large, semidouble. Average, open growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha' × Reticulata 'Crimson Robe'). (N.Z. 1972 - D. G. O'Toole, Ohope).

name: Temple Garden
description: Deep Pink. Very large, peony form with fluted and wavy petals. Vigorous, open growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Lila Naff' seedling). (Aus. 1986 - B. Hooper, Bexley North, NSW).

name: Temple Mist
description: Rose Pink with iridescent petals. Large to very large, semidouble with irregular petals. Average, upright growth. M. (Reticulata × Japonica). (U.S. 1967 - Maitland).

name: Temptation
description: White Blushed Pink on petal edges. Medium, single.

name: Ten Below
description: Bright Red. Large, semidouble. M. Cold hardy. (U.S. 1960 - Ashby).

name: Ten Plus
description: Pink with mottled Whitish Pink center petals. Large to very large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata/Japonica hybrid). (U.S. 1980 - Pursel).

name: Tenju
description: Blush Pink. Medium to large, wavy petaled single with flared Pale Yellow stamens. See Higo.

name: Tennin-Kwan
description: See 'Nagasaki'.

name: Teresa Ragland
description: Deep Coral Pink with White stamens. Large, semidouble with six separated fascicles of stamens in a circle spreading over petals and small, folded, swirled petals in center of incurved stamens. Average, open growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - Ragland).

name: Teringa
description: Crimson. Large, single. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Aus. 1955 - Turnbull).

name: Terrell Weaver
description: Flame to Dark Red. Large to very large, semidouble to loose peony form with thick fluted and twisted petals. Vigorous, spreading, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Japonica 'Ville De Nantes'). (U.S. 1974 - Homeyer).

name: Terry Clayton Newell
description: Light Pink. Large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 1966 - Bray).

name: Terry Gilley
description: Brilliant Red with Yellow anthers and Cream filaments. Large, semidouble with wavy, crinkled petals. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Japonica 'Dr. W. G. Lee' x Japonica 'Tomorrow's Dawn'). (U.S. 1974 - Gilley).

name: Terrye Eller
description: Light Blush Pink with Darker Pink margins and suffused Darker Pink. Small, rose form double. Average growth. E-M. (U.S. 1960 - J. E. Miller, New Orleans, LA).

name: Thai Silk
description: Salmon Pink. Medium, single with crepe and crinkled petals. Slow, dwarf, bushy growth. E-M. (Reticulata seedling). (U.S. 1992 - Nuccio's).

name: Thalia
description: White flower with outer half suffused with Pink. Miniature, loose peony to rose form double. Dense, semi-dwarf growth. E- M. (U.S. 1996 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Thanksgiving
description: Turkey Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, open growth. E-M. (U.S. 1959 - H. Larson, Orange, CA).

name: The Bride
description: Blush Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous growth. M. (U.S. 1958 - Shackelford).

name: The Czar
description: Light Crimson. Large, semidouble. Slow, sturdy growth. M. (For another form of this cultivar see 'Hugh Kennedy'). (Aus. 1913 - N. Breslin, Melbourne).

name: The Czar Variegated
description: Light Crimson blotched White variation of 'The Czar'.

name: The Daffodil
description: Deep Rose. Medium, semidouble resembling a deep cup daffodil. (U.S. 1953 - Fruitland).

name: The Duchess Of Cornwall
description: Pale Silvery Pink. Large, semidouble. Spreading growth. M. (Saluenensis x Japonica 'Adolphe Audusson'). (England 1981 - Carlyon).

name: The Elf
description: Light Pink. Medium to large, semidouble. Slow, compact, dwarf growth. M. (U.S. 1984 - Alfter).

name: The Flirt
description: Blush Pink. Large, semidouble with undulating, notched petals and two or three large petaloids interspersed with White stamens. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1961 - Ragland).

name: The Hobbit
description: Creamy White. Small to medium, single to semidouble. Average, dense, medium growth. E. (N.Z. 2007 - Haydon).

name: The Mikado
description: Rose Pink with narrow, White border. Medium, semidouble. (Sport of Japonica 'Herme'). (Japan to England 1889 - G Waller).

name: The Pilgrim
description: Cream White. Large, full peony form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1956 - Short).

name: The Real Mccoy
description: White. Large, semidouble with irregular petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1959 - E. McCoy, Fairhope, AL).

name: The Red Baron
description: Deep Red. Medium, rose form double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E. (Hybrid 'J. C. Williams' seedling). (U.S. 1975 - C. R. Phillips, Frederick, MD).

name: The Sam Stallings
description: Cream White. Large, semidouble with stamens intermixed with petals. (U.S. 1961 - S.H. Stallings, Smithfield, NC).

name: The Surrealist
description: Glowing shade of Rose-Red. Large, unknown form. Fast, bushy, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 2015 - Bobby Green, Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Thelma Dale
description: Phlox Pink form of 'Mrs. Baldwin Wood'. Medium, semidouble. (U.S. 1948 - Bradford).

name: Thelma Dale Blush
description: Blush Pink. (Sport of Japonica "Thelma Dale'). (U.S. 1963 - E F Wilkerson, Biloxi, MS).

name: Thelma Sanford
description: See 'Ruth Royer'.

name: Theme Song
description: Red. Medium to large, semidouble with stamen cluster. Slow, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1975 - Novick).

name: Theo De Tullio
description: Light tinted Blush Pink. Large, semidouble with three alternate rows of sweet pea shaped, curved petals and narrower, curved center petals. Average, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1965 - Julington).

name: Theo's Mini
description: Rose Pink. Miniature, anemone form. Average growth. M. (U.S. 1981 - Stone).

name: Theola Clark
description: Rose Red. Large, peony form with White stamens. Vigorous, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1962 - Dr. Parker, Lucedale, MS).

name: Theresa Burnham
description: Dark Red. Medium, formal double. Average, upright, dense growth. E-M. (Japonica 'Marc Eleven' x unknown pollen parent). (U.S. 2013 - Walter Creighton, Semmes, AL).

name: Theresa Marie
description: White spotted Pink and Red. Medium, rose form double to peony form. Vigorous growth. (U.S. 1951 - Malbis Nursery, Daphne, AL).

name: Thirty Drops
description: Delicate Pink. Miniature, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1971 - D. C. Strother, Fort Valley, GA).

name: Thomas Cornelius Cole
description: Bright Rose Pink. Large to very large, semidouble. Upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 1956 - Cole).

name: Thomas D. Pitts
description: ('Snow White' [Rosedale Nursery]). White. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1954 - Nuccio's).

name: Thomas E. Gilley
description: Bright Pink. Large, semidouble with crinkled petals. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Mouchang' seedling). (U.S. 1983 - Gilley).

name: Thomas Plant
description: See 'Frau Geheimrat Oldevig'.

name: Thomas Treseder
description: Salmon Rose veined Rose. Medium, rose form double to peony form. Compact, upright growth. M. (Aus. 1949 - Hazelwood).

name: Thomas Walter Savige
description: Red. Large, rose form double to peony form. Vigorous, spreading growth. M-L. (Aus. 1995 - T. Savige, Wirlinga, NSW).

name: Thomasville Beauty
description: Soft Pink. Large, anemone form with some White, Pink and fimbriated petaloids. Average, spreading growth. E- M. (U.S. 1969 - Dr. M. B. Wine, Thomasville, GA).

name: Thompsonii
description: White flecked and penciled Pink; sports Light Pink to Pink. Medium, full peony form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. E-M. (England. 1838 - Thompson).

name: Three Dreams
description: Deep Rose Pink. Large to very large, semidouble with wavy, crinkled petals. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha' seedling). (U.S. 1970 - Peer). Q.

name: Thumbellina
description: Rose Red sometimes edged darker. Small to medium, formal double. (Sport of Japonica "Tom Thumb'). (U.S. 1977 - A. Krueger, Monterey Park, CA).

name: Thunderbolt
description: See 'Glen 40 Variegated'.

name: Thunderhead
description: See 'Mrs'. Baldwin Wood.

name: Tiara
description: Orange Red. Medium, semidouble to formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. Early 1900's - Magnolia).

name: Tiara Variegated
description: Orange Red and White form of 'Tiara'.

name: Tick Tock
description: White striped and flecked Cherry Red. Large, full peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1955 - Tick Tock).

name: Tick Tock Blush
description: Blush Pink. (Sport of Japonica "Tick Tock'). (U.S. 1962 - Tammia).

name: Tick Tock Red
description: Red. (Sport of Japonica 'Tick Tock').

name: Tick Tock Red Variegated
description: Red marked White variation of 'Tick Tock Red'.

name: Tick Tock Speckled
description: White speckled and marked Cherry Red. (Sport of Japonica 'Tick Tock'). (U.S. 1965 - Tick Tock).

name: Tickled Pink
description: Fluorescent Pink. Medium to large, loose peony form with fluffy, outer petals. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1959 - Tammia).

name: Tickled Pink Variegated
description: Pink blotched White variation of "Tickled Pink'.

name: Tidbit
description: Blush Pink with Dark Pink markings. Miniature, semidouble of pine cone form. (Hybrid seedling). (U.S. 1983 - Kramer).

name: Tiddlywinks
description: Light Pink striped Dark Pink. Miniature, formal double. Average, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1981 - J. A. Lynch, Franklinton, LA).

name: Tiffany
description: Light Orchid Pink to Deeper Pink at edge. Large to very large, loose peony form to anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1962 - Dr. J. H. Urabec, La Cañada, CA).

name: Tiffany's Dawn
description: Pale Pink. Medium, semidouble to anemone form. Slow, upright growth. M-L. (Aus. 2002 - Jim Scott, Howrah, Tasmania).

name: Tiffy J
description: Blush Pink. Very large, loose peony form to rose form double. Average, spreading, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1991 - O. Jacobson, Jacksonville Beach, FL).

name: Tiger Eyes
description: Red with some Black edging on petals at times. Miniature, formal double form. Average, upright, spreading growth. E-M. (U.S. 2020 - Tom Corley, Auburn, AL).

name: Tiki
description: Rosy Salmon with petaloids streaked White and edged Rosy Salmon. Small, anemone form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1962 - McCaskill).

name: Til Andia
description: White. Large, semidouble. (U.S. 1955 - Domoto).

name: Tillie Rice
description: See 'Claudia Phelps'.

name: Tillie Wirth
description: Pink and White. Large to very large, semidouble to loose peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Big Beauty'). (U.S. 1954 - H. G. Fritchie, Slidell, LA).

name: Tim Crocker's Pink
description: Medium Pink. Small to medium, formal double, star form. Average, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 2001 - Eileen C. Hart, Odessa, FL).

name: Timothy Gilley
description: Rose Pink. Large, semidouble with wavy, crinkled petals. Average growth. M. (U.S. 1982 - Gilley).

name: Tina
description: White. Large, formal double. Average, compact, upright growth. E. (U.S. 1977 - Gilley).

name: Tina Gilliard
description: Pink. Medium, semidouble with wavy petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. Early 1900's - Magnolia).

name: Tini Faces
description: White with Rose and Carmine stripes and specks Miniature, semidouble. Average, spreading growth. M. (U.S. 1997 - D. Mayfield, Baton Rouge, LA).

name: Tinker Bell
description: White striped Pink and Rose Red. Small, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (For another form of this cultivar see 'Jingle Bells'). (U.S. 1958 - Nuccio's).

name: Tinker Toy
description: White speckled and striped Rose Red. Miniature, anemone form. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1981 - Nuccio's).

name: Tinky Lee
description: Soft Rose Pink. Medium, formal double to rose form double. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1947 - Lee).

name: Tinky Lee Variegated
description: Soft Rose Pink and White form of 'Tinky Lee.

name: Tinsie
description: ('Bokuhan'). Red outer guard petals and White center. Miniature, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-M. (Japan to U.S. 1930 - Star).

name: Tinsie Gold
description: Red outer guard petals and White center. Miniature, anemone form. Average, dense, upright growth. E-M. (Genetic leaf sport of Japonica "Tinsie'; 'leaves having a wide Yellow border'). (Aus. 1992 - Dr. G. Downe, Endeavor Hills, Vic.).

name: Tinsie Grande
description: Red Guard petals with the center of Red frilled petaloids. Small, anemone form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Tinsie (Bokuhan)'). (U.S. 2009 - Nuccio's).

name: Tinsie Two
description: Deep Rose Red outer guard petals with Pink stamens and petaloids. Small, anemone form. Average, compact, upright growth. E- M. (U.S. 1959 - Short).

name: Tinsley Smith
description: Cherry Red to Dark Rose Red veined Dark Red. Large, semidouble with wavy petals and five groups of stamens flaring in star-like formation. Average, spreading growth. M. (U.S. 1952 - Miss R. Loman, Wilmington, NC).

name: Tinsley Smith Variegated
description: Dark Rose Red and White variation of "Tinsley Smith'.

name: Tiny Bell
description: Salmon Pink. Small, semidouble to loose anemone form. Average, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1966 - Domoto).

name: Tiny Bit
description: Soft Pink. Miniature, anemone form. Slow, spreading growth. M. (Saluenensis × Non-reticulata hybrid "Tiny Princes'). (N.Z. 1987 - F. Jury, Tikorangi).

name: Tiny Bud
description: Clear Pink. Small, peony form. M-L. (U.S. 1955 - Mrs. C. Grischow, Portland, OR).

name: Tiny Girl
description: Salmon Pink. Small, formal double. Vigorous, open growth. M-L. (Sasanqua/Reticulata seedling). (U.S. 1981 - E. P. Akin, Shreveport, La).

name: Tiny Me
description: Light Pink with light to heavy variegation. Miniature, anemone form. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1969 - Haynie).

name: Tiny Pearl
description: Light Pearl Pink. Miniature, semidouble.

name: Tiny Princess
description: White shaded delicate Pink. Miniature, semidouble to peony form with loose petals and small petaloids. Slow growth. E-M. (Japonica 'Akebono' x Fraterna). (U.S. 1961 - Sawada).

name: Tiny Rose
description: Rose Pink. Miniature, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1997 - Domoto).

name: Tiny Star
description: Soft Pink. Miniature, semidouble. Open, upright growth. E-M. (Japonica 'Berenice Boddy' × Hybrid "Tiny Princess'). (N.Z. 1978 - O. Blumhardt, Whangarei).

name: Tiny Tot
description: White with occasional Pink streak. Miniature, formal double. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1961 - Short).

name: Tip Tipton
description: Pink. Medium to large, semidouble with irregular petals to peony form. Average growth. E. (U.S. 1963 - A. L. Tipton, Albany, GA).

name: Tip Top
description: White with occasional Pink stripe. Miniature, formal double. Slow, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1980 - Mealing).

name: Tiptoe
description: Silvery Pink deepening to Cherry Pink at edge. Medium, semidouble. Compact, upright growth. (Japonica × Williamsii 'Farfalla'). (Aus. 1965 - Camellia Grove Nsy.).

name: Titirangi
description: China Rose. Large, semidouble. Average, open, upright growth. E-L. (Saluenensis × Reticulata hybrid 'Buddha'). (N.Z. 1972 - Clark).

name: Titletown Usa
description: Light Pink with Golden Yellow anthers and Yellow filaments. Medium to large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Suzanne Withers' × Reticulata hybrid 'Hulyn Smith). (U.S. 2009 - Hulyn Smith).

name: Toby
description: Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1998 - P. Gilley, Grand Ridge, FL).

name: Todd Gilley
description: Bright Dark Red. Large, peony form with velvet texture. Average, spreading, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1974 - Gilley).

name: Togetherness
description: Pale Pink shading to Deep Pink at outer petal edges. Miniature, single, with fluted and notched petals. Slow, dense, upright growth. E-M. Fragrant. (Hybrid 'Snow Drop' seedling). (Aus. 1995 - M. Baker, Macleod, Vic.).

name: Toichi Domoto
description: Rose Pink with Deep Rose Pink stripes. Medium, formal double to rose form double. Slow, upright, compact growth. E-M. (U.S. 2006 - Nuccio's).

name: Tokamachi
description: Purplish Pink. Medium, single to semidouble.

name: Tokayama
description: White. Medium, formal double. Average, bushy growth. M. (Japan 1956 - Satomi).

name: Toki-No-Hagasane (Feather Of Wild Goose)
description: ('Bessie Morse Bellingrath'; 'Ubane'; 'Kent Deigaard'; 'Betty Hopfer'). White Blushed 40 mine left in chanter Pink with Deeper Pink under petals. Medium, semidouble. Slow, Compact growth. L. (Japan 1934 - Chugai).

name: Tokiiro-Wabisuke
description: See 'Momoiro-Wabisuke' Camellia Species The genus Camellia is endemic to Southeastern Asia. It is a large genus belonging to the tea family or theaceae. Professor Sealy (1958) comprehensively studied the 81 known species and grouped them into 12 sections. Ming (2000) followed Sealy's system placing the number of species at 199. Professor Chang (1998). worked with more plant material in his investigation. He estimated the number of species to be 280. More recently Gao, Parks and Du (2005) described 198 species in their book, Collected

name: Tom Cat
description: Light Rose Pink. Large, semidouble with irregular, fluted petals. Average, open, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1964 - Dr. A. C. Tuck, Thomasville, GA).

name: Tom Cat Variegated
description: Light Rose Pink blotched White variation of "Tom Cat'.

name: Tom Clower
description: Phlox Pink. Medium, formal double. Vigorous, open growth. L. (U.S. 1950 - Clower).

name: Tom Durrant
description: Crimson. Large, peony form. Average, bushy, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Wild Form' × Reticulata 'Shot Silk'). (N.Z. 1966 - Dr. Jane Crisp, Tirau).

name: Tom Eagleson
description: Bright Red. Medium to large, rose form double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1973 - T. Eagleson, Port Arthur, TX).

name: Tom Hatley
description: Vivid Deep Red with Yellow anthers and White to Pink filaments. Medium to large, classic semidouble to sometimes irregular semidouble. Average, upright, open growth. M. (U.S. 2011 - M. Thomas Hatley, Charlotte, NC).

name: Tom Herrin
description: White marked Red, occasionally sporting Red. Large, semidouble to peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1962 - Herrin).

name: Tom Herrin Red
description: Red. (Sport of Japonica 'Tom Herrin').

name: Tom Hoffman
description: Red. Large to very large, semidouble. Average, compact, upright growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' × Reticulata/ Japonica hybrid). (U.S. 1982 - Pursel).

name: Tom Howe
description: Whit striped Pink. Large, single to anemone form. Upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1959 - Azalea Glen).

name: Tom Knudsen
description: Dark Red with darker veining. Medium, formal double to rose form double to full peony form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1965 - Maitland).

name: Tom Perkins
description: Rose Red outer petals, Neyron-Rose mid petals, and blossom Pink inner petals. Large, formal double with high imbricated petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Hybrid 'Creation' seedling). (U.S. 1994| - F. Becker II, Brookhaven, MS).

name: Tom Thumb
description: Pink with each petal edged White. Small to medium, formal double. Average, upright growth. M. (For another form of this cultivar see Thumbellina'). (U.S. 1957 - A. Krueger, Monterey Park, CA).

name: Tom Thumb Blush
description: Blush Pink. (Sport of Japonica "Tom Thumb'). (U.S. 1999 - V. Stone, Baton Rouge, LA).

name: Tommie Bowman
description: Red with Purple tint. Medium, anemone form. Average, dense, upright growth. E-M. Cold hardy. (U.S. 2000 - Elizabeth R. Scott, Aiken, SC).

name: Tommy Land
description: Dark Red. Very large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Lutchuensis). (U.S. 1991 - Pursel).

name: Tommy Weeks
description: Dark Red. Large, semidouble. Average, spreading growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata hybrid 'Jean Pursel'). (U.S. 1983 - Pursel).

name: Tomo-Chi-Chi
description: Dark Red. Large, semidouble to loose peony form. M. (U.S. 1959 - A. Funk, Savannah, GA).

name: Tomorrow
description: ('Ed Anderson'). Strawberry Red. Large to very large, semidouble with irregular petals and large petaloids to full peony form. Vigorous, open, slightly pendulous growth. E-M. (U.S. 1953 - Tick Tock).

name: Tomorrow Crown Jewel
description: White brushed Red in throat with occasional streak of Red on one or more petals. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow'). (U.S. 1967 - Tick Tock).

name: Tomorrow Park Hill
description: Light soft Pink generally deepening toward edge with some White variegation. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow Variegated'). (U.S. 1964 - Peer).

name: Tomorrow Park Hill Blush
description: Soft Light Pink. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow Park Hill'). (U.S. 1979 - R. S. Magee, Bogalusa, LA).

name: Tomorrow Park Hill Fimbriated
description: Soft Pink similar to "Tomorrow Park Hill' with Yellow anthers and Yellow filaments. Large, semidouble to full peony form; the fimbriation is reliable, but varies from light to medium extending from center of bloom outward. Vigorous, upright, spreading growth. E-M. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow Park Hill'). (U.S. 2016 - Jim Pinkerton, Lugoff, SC and Herbert Racoff, Columbia, SC).

name: Tomorrow Park Hill Pink
description: Large to very large, semidouble to loose peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Tomorrow Park Hill' without White variegation).

name: Tomorrow Peony Variegated
description: Strawberry Red. Large to very large, full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow Variegated'). (U.S. 1966 - RE Ward, Jr., Birmingham, AL).

name: Tomorrow Supreme
description: See 'Tomorrow Variegated'.

name: Tomorrow Tuxedo
description: See 'Tomorrow Variegated'.

name: Tomorrow Variegated
description: ('Maverick'; 'Tomorrow Supreme'; 'Tomorrow Tuxedo'). Strawberry Red blotched White variation of "Tomorrow'. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (For another variation of this cultivar see 'Queen of Tomorrow').

name: Tomorrow White
description: White. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow'). (U.S. 1984 - J. Movich, La Verne, CA).

name: Tomorrow's Dawn
description: Deep soft Pink to Light Pink shading to White at edge with some White petaloids and one or more petals having streak of Red. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow'). (For a variation of this cultivar see 'Tomorrow, Leanne's'). (U.S. 1960 - L Ruffin and R Allums, Ellisville, MS).

name: Tomorrow's Dawn Bessie
description: Same as parent except wide border of White. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Tomorrow's Dawn'). (U.S. 1979 - B. Waters, Kilgore, TX).

name: Tomorrow's Dawn Blush
description: Blush Pink with White border. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow's Dawn'). (U.S. 1982 - C. Copeland, MS).

name: Tomorrow's Delight
description: Soft Creamy White with a few flecks and streaks of Red. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Tomorrow'). (U.S. 1971 - J. Fuller, Montgomery, AL).

name: Tomorrow's Lisa
description: Blush White with Red flakes and few streaks of Pink turning Red. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow Park Hill'). (U.S. 1977 - A. P. Fatherree, Jackson, MS).

name: Tomorrow's Sweet Image
description: Pale Orchid Pink heavily variegated White. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow Park Hill'). (Reported as similar to "Tomorrow Park Hill'). (U.S. 1972 -J L Carvain, Fort Worth, TX).

name: Tomorrow's Tropic Dawn
description: White with occasional Red line or dash, fading to Blush as flower ages. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Tomorrow's Dawn'). (U.S. 1967 - R M Merino, Fresno, CA).

name: Tomorrow, Leanne's
description: Coral Rose. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica "Tomorrow'). (U.S. 1964 - L Ming, Natchez, MS).

name: Tomorrow, Marbury's Light Pink
description: Light Pink edged Lighter Pink to White. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Tomorrow'). (U.S. 1977 - Marbury).

name: Tongzimian
description: See 'Baby Face'.

name: Toni Finlay's Fragrant
description: Pink. Medium, anemone form. Average growth. E-M. Fragrant. (Japonica 'Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' x Hybrid 'Salab' x Japonica 'Look-Away'). (N.Z. 1994 - J. Finlay).

name: Toni Lee
description: Pale to Deep Pink. Miniature, single. Slow, spreading growth. E-L. (Hybrid seedling). (N.Z. 1994 - K. Watson, Waikanae).

name: Tonnie Leche
description: See 'Alba Superba'.

name: Tony Hunt
description: Pink. Very large, semidouble to loose peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Overture' x Reticulata hybrid 'LASCA Beauty'). (Aus. 1991 - J. Hunt, Boronia, Vic.).

name: Tony Pinheiro
description: Red. Very large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright, dense growth. E-L. (Reticulata hybrid 'Four Winds' x Reticulata hybrid 'Lillette Witman'). (U.S. 2000 - Mary Jo Pinheiro, Modesto, CA).

name: Tony's Joy
description: Bright Red. Large to very large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Reticulata x Japonica). (U.S. 1975 - A. Funari, Santa Clara, CA).

name: Tonya
description: Brilliant Red. Large, semidouble with wavy, crinkled petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1976 - Gilley).

name: Tooey
description: Soft Pink. Large, loose peony form with incurved petals covering stamens. Slow, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1965 - Ashby).

name: Tootie
description: Pink. Large to very large, semidouble. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1982 - M. McLeod, Monticello, FL).

name: Tootsie
description: Chalk White. Miniature, formal double, sometimes in form of five pointed star. Slow, open, spreading growth. M-L. (U.S. 1967 - R. E. Ward, Jr., Birmingham, AL).

name: Top Fragrance
description: Deep Pink. Medium, anemone to peony form. Average, upright, dense growth. E-M. Light fragrance. ([Japonica 'Mrs. Bertha A. Harms' x Hybrid 'Salab') x Japonica Tama-Ikari] × Japonica 'Kramer's Supreme'). (N.Z. 1999 - J. Finlay).

name: Top O' The Morn
description: Pink striped and blended Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, compact growth. M-L. (U.S. 1957 - Hearn).

name: Topiary Pink
description: Clear Blush Pink. Miniature, formal double form with no stamens; dense pillar form. Slow, upright growth. M. (Pitardii seedling). (N.Z. 2003 - Mark Jury).

name: Tori-No-Ko (Chicken)
description: Pinkish White slightly striped Darker Pink. Large, semidouble of lotus form. Slow, compact growth. M-L. (Japan 1956 - E. Satomi, Tokyo).

name: Totenko
description: Red. Medium, peony form.

name: Totts
description: White to Creamy Yellow. Very large, peony form. Vigorous, dense, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1993 - R. Ehrhart, Walnut Creek, CA).

name: Touch Of Pink
description: Blush Pink to Deeper Pink tipped edges. Large to very large, semidouble with irregular petals to anemone form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1977 - Nuccio's).

name: Touchdown
description: Deep Rose Pink. Large to very large, loose peony form. (Sport of Japonica 'Kick Off'). (For another form of this cultivar see 'Cheerleader'). (U.S. 1962 - Nuccio's).

name: Touchdown Blush
description: Blush Pink. (Sport of Japonica "Touchdown'). (U.S. 1975 - G. Stewart, Sacramento, CA).

name: Toy Trumpet
description: Rose Pink. Miniature, semidouble. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1963 - Dr. L. E. Chow, Bakersfield, CA).

name: Tracey Spencer
description: Rose Pink. Very large, semidouble with crimped, fluted petals. Vigorous, upright growth. E. (Reticulata hybrid "Wild Form' seedling). (Aus. 1970 - F. N. Spencer, Cheltenham, Vic.).

name: Tranquillity
description: Rose Pink. Large, semidouble to loose peony form. Vigorous, open, upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Cornelian' seedling). (Aus. 1969 - H. A. Pederson, Collaroy Plateau, NSW).

name: Transpink
description: Soft Pink. Miniature, trumpet shaped single form. Average, dense and upright growth. M-L. Honey fragrance. (Transnokoensis seedling). (N.Z. 2004 - Haydon).

name: Transtasman
description: Pale Pink edged Deeper Pink. Miniature, single. Average, upright growth. M-L. (Pitardii Variety Pitardii × Transnokoensis). (Aus. 1998 - R. Garnett, Beaumaris, Vic.).

name: Treasure Isle
description: Clear Rose Pink. Large, full peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1967 - Short).

name: Treasure Trove
description: Deep Red. Medium, peony form. Slow, dwarf, dense growth. M. (Hybrid 'Fantastic' × Hybrid 'Dark Nite'). (N.Z. 1991 - Jury).

name: Tregrehan
description: Apricot Pink. Medium, semidouble to rose form double. Vigorous, upright growth. (Saluenensis x Japonica 'Marjorie Magnificent'). (England 1972 - Carlyon).

name: Tressie Dease
description: Pink. Medium, formal double. Average. upright, dense growth. (U.S. 2019 - Green Nurseries, Fairhope, AL).

name: Trev's Tinsie
description: Rose Pink with Pink striped Cream petaloids. Small, anemone form. Slow, open, spreading growth. M-L. (N.Z. 1984 - T Lennard, Te Puke).

name: Trevor Lennard
description: Deep Pink. Large, peony form. Average, open, spreading growth. E-M. (Reticulata hybrid 'Flower Girl' × Reticulata hybrid 'Carl Tourje'). (N.Z. 1991 - T. Lennard, Te Puke).

name: Trewithen Pink
description: Deep Rose. Large, semidouble. L. (Reticulata hybrid "Wild Form' seedling). (Aus. 1947 - Waterhouse).

name: Tricia
description: Light Pink. Large, anemone form. (Sport of Japonica 'Pat Nixon'). (U.S. 1974 - Kramer).

name: Tricolor (Siebold)
description: ('Wakanoura Variegated'). Waxy White streaked Carmine. Medium, semidouble of slightly cupped form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. Cold hardy. (Variations of this cultivar include 'Dainty [California]'; 'Fred Sander'; 'Jewel Bowden'; 'Blush Tricolor'; 'Chalk Pink'). (Japan to Germany 1832 - Siebold).

name: Tricolor (Siebold) Folki
description: See 'Lady de Saumarez'.

name: Tricolor (Siebold) Red
description: ('Red Douglas'; 'Robin Hood'; 'Wakanoura Red'; 'Wakanoura-Aka'). Cold hardy. (Solid Red variation of "Tricolor [Siebold]).'.

name: Tricolor (Siebold) White
description: See 'Leucantha'.

name: Tricolor California
description: ('Crichton'). White striped Pink to solid color. Medium, semidouble. Average, compact growth. L. (For other forms of this cultivar, see 'Annie Laurie' and 'Lois Hill'). (U.S. 1928 - Armstrong).

name: Tricolor Pink
description: Pink with Rose color stripes with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, semidouble of slightly cupped form. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Tricolor'). (U.S. 1937 - E. A. Mellhenny (Jungle Gardens), Avery Island, LA).

name: Tricolor Superba
description: Variable colors from nearly White to Solid Red, but majority White striped Red or Light Pink margined White with Golden anthers and White filaments. Large, semidouble. M. (Seedling of Japonica 'Tricolor'). (U.S. 1945 - K. Sawada, Overlook Nurseries, Crichton, AL).

name: Trinket
description: Soft Pink with shaded Pink center. Miniature to small, anemone form. Vigorous, bushy, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1973 - McCaskill).

name: Tristrem Carlyon
description: Rose Pink. Medium, peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. (Japonica 'Rosea Simplex' x Reticulata hybrid 'Salutation'). (England 1972 - Carlyon).

name: Triumph
description: Dark Red with Golden anthers and White filaments. Small, single. (U.S. 1942 - Magnolia Plantation & Gardens, Charleston, SC).

name: Triumphans
description: ('Triomphant'; 'Lady Parker Peony'; 'Allen's Pink'; 'Harmony'). Rose Pink splotched White. Large, peony form. Upright, open growth. M. (Belgium 1834).

name: Trixey
description: Bright Pink shading to White at center. Large, formal double. Slow, compact growth. L. (N.Z. 1998 - F. Upson, Kaponga).

name: Trojan Horse
description: Deep Pink. Large, semidouble to loose peony form. Average, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1968 - Wilkes Nsy., Moultrie, GA).

name: Trophy
description: Orchid Pink. Large, irregular rose form double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth; outstanding with gibberellic treatment. L. (Japonica 'Mrs. D. W. Davis Descanso' × Reticulata hybrid 'Nuccio's Ruby'). (U.S. 1988 - Nuccio's).

name: Troubadour
description: Salmon Pink. Medium, semidouble of pine cone form. Average, compact, upright growth. M. (For another form of this cultivar, see 'Jessie Katz'). (Europe to U.S. [Magnolia] 1840's).

name: Truda Jean
description: Pale Pink. Small to medium, single. Average, upright growth. E. (Aus. 1995 - Eryldene Trust, Gordon, NSW).

name: Trudy
description: Red with Red stamens. Miniature, single with five petals. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1952 - F. F. Baker, Macon, GA).

name: Trudy George
description: Pink with stripes as in 'Ben George' with Higo type stamen clusters; it has Yellow anthers and lighter colored filaments. Very large, single to semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Sport of Japonica 'Ben George'). (U.S. 2008 - Hulyn Smith).

name: Trudy Smith
description: Dark Red. Large to very large, semidouble to full peony form. Average growth. M-L. (Reticulata 'Crimson Robe' x Reticulata/ Japonica hybrid). (U.S. 1982 - Pursel).

name: True Echols
description: Rose Red. Large, peony form. Average, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1980 - Gilley).

name: True Love
description: Chalk White with faint dash of Pink on some petals. Large, semidouble to peony form shaped like six-pointed star. (U.S. 1959 - True's Camellias, Columbia, SC).

name: Trumpet Fanfare
description: Pillar Box Red. Medium, semidouble form, trumpet shaped. Average, dense, upright growth; petals are long, narrow and recurved. E. (Saluenensis x Japonica 'Ruby Bells' x Japonica x Reticulata hybrid 'Diamond Head'). (N.Z. 2003 - O. Blumhardt).

name: Tsubaki's Bona Bella
description: Rose Pink with White marks on the center of the petals. Medium to large, formal double. Vigorous, upright Q Aa 0 : growth. M-L. (Japonica 'Steve Blount' seedling). (U.S. 2013 - Tsubaki Camellias, Savannah, GA).

name: Tsugawa
description: Pink fading to White at edges. Small, rose form double.

name: Tsukasa-Nishiki
description: Pink mottled White. Medium, single. See Higo.

name: Tsuki-Sekai
description: Pink. Unknown size, single with variegated foliage.

name: Tsuzumi-Oka
description: Crimson. Large, rose form double.

name: Tu-Tu
description: Deep Orchid Pink. Small, peony form. Average, compact, upright growth. M. (Sasanqua x Sasanqua 'Shishi-Gashira'). (U.S. 1982 - Mrs. T. K. Knight, Baton Rouge, LA).

name: Tubby Habel
description: Dark Mahogany Red with dark veining. Medium to large, semidouble to anemone form. Average, spreading growth. L. (U.S. 1997 - Habel).

name: Tubilation
description: Pink with occasional Deeper Pink fleck. Large to very large, rose form double. Upright growth. M-L. (Unnamed Hybrid x Japonica 'Betty Sheffield Supreme'). (N.Z. 1978 - Jury).

name: Tudor Baby
description: Dark Red with petals edged Black. Small, formal double. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 2001 - Hulyn Smith).

name: Tudor Baby Variegated
description: Dark Red, blotched White variation of "Tudor Baby'. (U.S. 2001 - Hulyn Smith).

name: Tuesday's Child
description: Coral Red with Silver margined petals veined Red. Large, semidouble. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1960 - Camelliana).

name: Tuffet
description: Bright Red. Miniature, full peony form. Vigorous, upright growth. E-L. (U.S. 1963 - Mrs. B. Lindsey, San Diego, CA).

name: Tui Song
description: Rose Pink. Large, semidouble. Upright growth. M. (Reticulata 'Cornelian' seedling). (N.Z. 1967 - Clark).

name: Tulip Time
description: Light Pink. Medium, single of tulip form. Vigorous, upright growth. M. (Saluenensis hybrid). (U.S. 1978 - Feathers).

name: Turandot
description: Medium Red. Large, peony form. M-L. (U.S. - Parks).

name: Turkish Delight
description: Light Lavender Pink. Medium, semidouble with long, narrow, fluted, reflexed petals. Bushy growth. M. (Hybrid 'Cornish Snow' seedling). (Aus. 1968 - Tuckfield).

name: Turner Davis
description: White. Medium, formal double with incurved petals. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M-L. (U.S. 1980 - J. Hintermister, Gainesville, FL).

name: Turner's Camp
description: Dark Red. Large, semidouble with irregular petals. Average, compact growth. M. (U.S. 1954 - Turner).

name: Tutti Frutti
description: Multi-colors of White, Pink, and Red with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Medium, anemone form. Slow, upright, dense growth. E-M. (U.S. 2020 - Pat B. Johnson, Cairo, GA).

name: Twilight
description: Light Blush Pink. Medium to large, formal double. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. M. (U.S. 1964 - Nuccio's).

name: Twilight Glow
description: Rose. Unknown size, single. Compact, hardy growth. Cold hardy. (Oleifera x Sasanqua). (U.S. 2008 - Parks).

name: Twinkle
description: White, occasionally dashed Pink. Miniature, semidouble. Average, upright growth. L. (U.S. 1958).

name: Twinkle Star
description: Purplish Rose Pink. Small, rose form double to formal double. Average, open, upright growth. M. (Hybrid 'Elegant Beauty' x Japonica 'Tinsie'). (N.Z. 1989 - Jury).

name: Twinkle Twinkle
description: White, sometimes tinted Pink. Miniature, semidouble form with pointed petals, star shaped. (U.S. - Nuccio's)

name: Usubeni
description: See 'Showa-No-Sakae'.

name: Two Marthas
description: Lavender Pink. Medium, semidouble. Vigorous, compact, upright growth. E. (Sasanqua x Kissi). (U.S. 1981 - Ackerman).

name: Tyler Nation
description: Coral Red. Large, semidouble with four rows of petals and inner petals wavy and fluted. Open, upright growth. E-M. (U.S. 1958 - H. E. Nation, Montgomery, AL).

name: Tyler Studstill
description: Deep Wine Red with Yellow anthers and White filaments. Large, semidouble form with at least one large petaloid mixed with the stamens. Average, upright, open growth. M. (U.S. 2022 - Gordy).
